title: Drawing, "Architectural Fantasy: A Circular Temple on a Truncated Pyramid", mid-18th century
medium: Brush and gray and brown wash, over black chalk on off-white laid paper with additions at top and bottom, lined with cardboard and border of blue laid paper
markings:
Cooper Union Musuem mark at the lower right corner on the recto
Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
signed: Signed in pen and black ink at lower right corner: LL
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: In the foreground are ruins of a classical temple - a broken column and a pedestal.  Stairs lead up to a sepulchral monument and to an altar where a sacrifice is being conducted. In the distance are two free-standing monumental columns as well as a truncated pyramid crowned by a circular temple.  The sheet is enlarged at the bottom and slightly laterally by an L.L. who signed the original drawing.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Architectural Fantasy: A Circular Temple on a Truncated Pyramid", mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Brush and gray and brown wash, over black chalk on off-white laid paper with additions at top and bottom, lined with cardboard and border of blue laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-506.
